reviewText: My daughters (5 and 2 years old) love this movie.  In fact, they love all of these My Little Pony Movies made around the same time.  I believe it includes this one, Princess Promenade, Minty Christmas and A Very Pony Place.  They are visually very colorful and beautiful and the songs are happy and upbeat.  I also like that there are not any scary characters.  Reminds me of when I watched it in the 80s - just a wonderful movie!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am 31 year old and still love my Little pony because of the sillness and fun they have on their adventure !I start to watch My Little Pony : Runaway Rainbow and it was very colorfuland bright carttoon ! All My Little Pony are great and fun animation to watch ! I draw from watching this type of animation on dvd or vhs !I want to do a simliar carttoon like My Little Pony with a twist !I don't have a new animation storyline yet but drawing the inspiration from My Little Pony is worth it !
summary: My Little Pony collection for Christmas season !
Title: N/A

reviewText: My toddler daughter loves her "ponies" and the movies are no exception. So far she only has this one and The Princess Promenade though as there weren't a lot of them made. I can't stand the newest My Little Pony cartoons, with the ponies having the huge eyes and also I don't feel they still cater to such a wide age range as the original ponies and the mid-2000 pony movies/cartoons did. My toddler certainly doesn't show an interest in the newest ones and my 8 year old nieces don't seem to care for them either. I really wish there had been more movies made in the mid-2000's as they seem to really capture the spirit of the ponies. I have yet to purchase one of the movies from the 80's so I don't know how she will like those, but I am willing to try. I bought this one used and it came in like new condition so I was very pleased with that. I just wish there were more of them to buy.
summary: Wish there were more like this
Title: N/A

reviewText: For parents (or grandparents) looking for movies that a small child can enjoy, we have a 3 year oldgrand-daughter (who just recently watched her first movie in-theatre).  She enjoys certain animatedmovies on TV.  Like many kids when she enjoys something, she wants to see it over and over andOVER again.Recently we put on My Little Pony - The Runaway Rainbow.  She loved it.  It got time for her nap,grandma told her we needed to stop the movie for a while, and she CRIED, because she didn'twant to stop watching.  I'm not sure what the lower and upper age limit would be for this movie'sholding a kid's attention...offhand I would guess between about 2 ad 6 years old.There are some parents who avoid kids watching too much TV (or movies) because it must be"bad" for them.  However, well-done kids films have a lot going for them.  Often they can teachsome music appreciation, via the musical score.  Often they have some moral lessons in thestory.  And they can contribute, just like many other things, to "richness of environment" whichseems to stimulate still-developing brains and tends to make kids smarter.Bottom line: despite that she's very much a girl, her favorite movie so far actually is "Cars".  Shealso liked "Frozen" very much, and she also liked THIS--My Little Pony movie.
summary: Well actually my GRANDDAUGHTER loved it...

reviewText: My 6 and 3 year old daughters love this video and watch it over and over.  I don't mind it either.  It is well written and the songs are good too.  I don't know why they quit selling this video.  I think it was worth finding it and purchasing it on Amazon.
